bug.summary: Generating Alignments take longer time than prediction on a GPU
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
--print-alignment takes too much time on GPU probably due to extract_hard_alignment in utils <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run command in here. Same command with --print-alignment takes around 3X the time.
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
On CPU it takes only 70 ms to generate alignments for a batch size 32, beam size 5 and an average sequence size of 5. On GPU it is supposed to take around the same time, but is around 250 ms for the same sequences.
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version - 0.9.0 / master(e.g., 1.0 or master): PyTorch Version - 1.5.0 OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed fairseq (pip, source): pip Build command you used (if compiling from source): pip install --editable Python version: 3.7.5 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.2 GPU models and configuration: fconv pre-trained
